content: >http://www.miamiherald.com/459/story/1050424.html Personnel at three Florida state prisons must have been the victims of a 'bubba effect' mass hallucination. A decision was made that, with parental approval, they were going to demonstrate electrical immobilization devices on the 'kiddies' on a work experience day. 43 kids got a 'little jolt' to see what it was like. Another group got an accidental 'whiff of tear gas' at another facility. What's the harm in that? They didn't demonstrate a cell extraction or a bean bagging. Needless to say resignations, firings and discipline ensue.
reply: >http://www.miamiherald.com/459/story/1050424.html Personnel at three Florida state prisons must have been the victims of a 'bubba effect' mass hallucination.
